poem:
**The Minister Speaks of Sympathy**

In the quiet chambers where echoes linger,  
the minister murmurs of a gentle reset,  
brushing the dust from the shoulders of artists,  
whose hands once ink-stained, now bear  
a digital ghost.

The ministering of sympathy  
floats on air, thin as sunlight,  
waiting to embrace those hollowed by  
the unknowable hum of the Algorithm.
